1.Pros: Great entry level experience. high school or part time supplemental

2.Pros: Worked around my schedule well. Work was fast paced. It was good for a high schooler.
2.Cons: Management was a joke. No advancement or raise in the year I worked there. Super high turnover for a reason

3.Pros: Great 1st job for a high school kid, very flexible with schedule and easy to get hired, pay is average minimum wage
3.Cons: Minimum wage, hard work, takes a lot of patience to get through the training but if you give it time , it gets better

4.Pros: It's a job that you are almost certainly able to get, they will take pretty much anyone. And the people are good, you all bond under the unnecessary duress and unsatisfactory working circumstances.

5.Pros: It's very clean.very good good & drinks.I plan on furthering my education soon.
5.Cons: Some of them managers think just cause they have a tire n a shirt on think they can talk to us crewmembers any kind of way & that's not right.

6.Pros: - Easy to get hired- Easy job, just fast paced enough to make time go by quick- I had great coworkers, but YMMV
6.Cons: - Stressful if you work at a busy location- If your coworkers suck, your life will suck

7.Pros: Working at McDonald's you can get raises very quickly and it's really easy to learn the positions. You can also get promoted fairly easily and it's a fast paced job and everyday you encounter something different.
7.Cons: They don't really give you a lot of opportunity to grow and learn, and they really don't care about the employees. They tend to hire too many people and that can negatively effect you're hours. And they don't expect you to stay long and you can tell.

8.Pros: Management training gives you college credits
8.Cons: Low pay, not appreciated as a person, very stressful

9.Pros: Got to cook lots of burgers.
9.Cons: Fish fillets are not my thing.
